cursor.description: Used for pagination.  When a list request has more records available, cursors are provided in the response headers `X-Files-Cursor-Next` and `X-Files-Cursor-Prev`.  Send one of those cursor value here to resume an existing list from the next available record.  Note: many of our SDKs have iterator methods that will automatically handle cursor-based pagination.

per_page.description: Number of records to show per page.  (Max: 10,000, 1,000 or less is recommended).

sort_by.description: If set, sort records by the specified field in either `asc` or `desc` direction (e.g. `sort_by[group_id]=desc`). Valid fields are `group_id`, `path`, `user_id` or `permission`.

filter.description: If set, return records where the specified field is equal to the supplied value. Valid fields are `group_id`, `user_id` or `path`. Valid field combinations are `[ group_id, path ]` and `[ user_id, path ]`.

filter_prefix.description: If set, return records where the specified field is prefixed by the supplied value. Valid fields are `path`.

path.description: DEPRECATED: Permission path.  If provided, will scope permissions to this path. Use `filter[path]` instead.

group_id.description: DEPRECATED: Group ID.  If provided, will scope permissions to this group. Use `filter[group_id]` instead.`

user_id.description: DEPRECATED: User ID.  If provided, will scope permissions to this user. Use `filter[user_id]` instead.`

include_groups.description: If searching by user or group, also include user's permissions that are inherited from its groups?

$ul: **recursive**: Does this permission apply to subfolders?
